definition: to startle/to be frightened/to be scared/alarm

sentences.english: Entering the falls on foot costs $10 and the views are still breathtaking.
sentences.chinese: 步行进入瀑布需10美元，而景色依然让人惊叹不已。

sentences.english: The spectacular sunrise made us exclaim in surprise.
sentences.chinese: 壮观的日出让我们惊叹不已。

sentences.english: How did Lady Brandon describe this wonderful young man ?
sentences.chinese: 勃兰登夫人怎么描绘这位叫人惊叹不已的年轻人呢？

sentences.english: The only surprise in all this is that anybody should be surprised.
sentences.chinese: 所有这一切唯一惊喜的可能让每个人都惊叹不已。

sentences.english: Just arrived by the room that Anne Zhe seeks inside, really made me don't already marvel.
sentences.chinese: 刚来到安哲找的公寓里，着实让我惊叹不已。

sentences.english: The foreigners were amazed at the ancient civilizations of China.
sentences.chinese: 这些外国人对中国的古代文明惊叹不已。

sentences.english: The children were awed by the exaggerated contortion of the clown's body.
sentences.chinese: 孩子们对小丑夸张扭曲的身体惊叹不已。

definition: (idiom) to gasp in amazement/to acclaim as the peak of perfection
to click one's tongue in wonder (idiom)/to be astonished
to exclaim in admiration/a gasp of surprise
to consider oneself as being not as good as the others
unheard of/an extremely rare and unprecedented event
to have a whole new level of respect for sb or sth/to sit up and take notice (of sb's improved performance etc)
to feel deep veneration for sb (idiom)
lit. as if drunk and stupefied (idiom)/fig. intoxicated by sth/obsessed with/mad about sth
one's thoughts fly to a longed-for place or person/to long for/infatuated/fascinated
